trans-unit.source: Setting up a pull client using configuration names
trans-unit.target: Setting up a pull client using configuration names

trans-unit.source: powershell,DSC
trans-unit.target: powershell,DSC

trans-unit.source: Setting up a pull client using configuration names
trans-unit.target: Setting up a pull client using configuration names

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: Each target node has to be told to use pull mode and given the URL where it can contact the pull server to get configurations.
trans-unit.target: Each target node has to be told to use pull mode and given the URL where it can contact the pull server to get configurations.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you have to configure the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) with the necessary information.To configure the LCM, you create a special type of configuration, decorated with the **DSCLocalConfigurationManager** attribute.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you have to configure the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) with the necessary information.To configure the LCM, you create a special type of configuration, decorated with the **DSCLocalConfigurationManager** attribute.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring the LCM, see [Configuring the Local Configuration Manager](metaConfig.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring the LCM, see [Configuring the Local Configuration Manager](metaConfig.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note**: This topic applies to PowerShell 5.0.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: This topic applies to PowerShell 5.0.

trans-unit.source: For information on setting up a pull client in PowerShell 4.0, see [Setting up a pull client using configuration ID in PowerShell 4.0](pullClientConfigID4.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on setting up a pull client in PowerShell 4.0, see [Setting up a pull client using configuration ID in PowerShell 4.0](pullClientConfigID4.md)

trans-unit.source: The following script configures the LCM to pull configurations from a server named "CONTOSO-PullSrv":
trans-unit.target: The following script configures the LCM to pull configurations from a server named "CONTOSO-PullSrv":

trans-unit.source: In the script, the **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** block defines the pull server.
trans-unit.target: In the script, the **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** block defines the pull server.

trans-unit.source: The **ServerURL** property specifies the endpoint for the pull server.
trans-unit.target: The **ServerURL** property specifies the endpoint for the pull server.

trans-unit.source: The **RegistrationKey** property is a shared key between all client nodes for a pull server and that pull server.
trans-unit.target: The **RegistrationKey** property is a shared key between all client nodes for a pull server and that pull server.

trans-unit.source: The same value is stored in a file on the pull server.
trans-unit.target: The same value is stored in a file on the pull server.

trans-unit.source: The **ConfigurationNames** property is an array that specifies the names of the configurations intended for the client node.
trans-unit.target: The **ConfigurationNames** property is an array that specifies the names of the configurations intended for the client node.

trans-unit.source: On the pull server, the configuration MOF file for this client node must be named *ConfigurationNames*.mof, where *ConfigurationNames* matches the value of the **ConfigurationNames** property you set in this metaconfiguration.
trans-unit.target: On the pull server, the configuration MOF file for this client node must be named *ConfigurationNames*.mof, where *ConfigurationNames* matches the value of the **ConfigurationNames** property you set in this metaconfiguration.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If you specify more than one value in the **ConfigurationNames**, you must also specify **PartialConfiguration** blocks in your configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If you specify more than one value in the **ConfigurationNames**, you must also specify **PartialConfiguration** blocks in your configuration.

trans-unit.source: For information about partial configurations, see [PowerShell Desired State Configuration partial configurations](partialConfigs.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about partial configurations, see [PowerShell Desired State Configuration partial configurations](partialConfigs.md).

trans-unit.source: After this script runs, it creates a new output folder named **PullClientConfigNames** and puts a metaconfiguration MOF file there.
trans-unit.target: After this script runs, it creates a new output folder named **PullClientConfigNames** and puts a metaconfiguration MOF file there.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the metaconfiguration MOF file will be named `localhost.meta.mof`.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the metaconfiguration MOF file will be named `localhost.meta.mof`.

trans-unit.source: To apply the configuration, call the **Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager** cmdlet, with the **Path** set to the location of the metaconfiguration MOF file.
trans-unit.target: To apply the configuration, call the **Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager** cmdlet, with the **Path** set to the location of the metaconfiguration MOF file.

trans-unit.source: For example: `Set-DSCLocalConfigurationManager localhost –Path .\PullClientConfigNames –Verbose.`
trans-unit.target: For example: `Set-DSCLocalConfigurationManager localhost –Path .\PullClientConfigNames –Verbose.`

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Registration keys work only with web pull servers.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Registration keys work only with web pull servers.

trans-unit.source: You must still use **ConfigurationID** with an SMB pull server.
trans-unit.target: You must still use **ConfigurationID** with an SMB pull server.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a pull server by using **ConfigurationID**, see [Setting up a pull client using configuration ID](PullClientConfigNames.md)
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a pull server by using **ConfigurationID**, see [Setting up a pull client using configuration ID](PullClientConfigNames.md)

trans-unit.source: Resource and report servers
trans-unit.target: Resource and report servers

trans-unit.source: If you specify only a **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** or **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** block in your LCM configuration (as in the previous example), the pull client will pull resources from the specified server, but it will not send reports to it.
trans-unit.target: If you specify only a **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** or **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** block in your LCM configuration (as in the previous example), the pull client will pull resources from the specified server, but it will not send reports to it.

trans-unit.source: You can use a single pull server for configurations, resources, and reporting, but you have to create a **ReportRepositoryWeb** block to set up reporting.
trans-unit.target: You can use a single pull server for configurations, resources, and reporting, but you have to create a **ReportRepositoryWeb** block to set up reporting.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a metaconfiguration that sets up a client to pull configurations and resources, and send reporting data, to a single pull server.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a metaconfiguration that sets up a client to pull configurations and resources, and send reporting data, to a single pull server.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify different pull servers for resources and reporting.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify different pull servers for resources and reporting.

trans-unit.source: To specify a resource server, you use either a **ResourceRepositoryWeb** (for a web pull server) or a **ResourceRepositoryShare** block (for an SMB pull server).
trans-unit.target: To specify a resource server, you use either a **ResourceRepositoryWeb** (for a web pull server) or a **ResourceRepositoryShare** block (for an SMB pull server).

trans-unit.source: To specify a report server, you use a **ReportRepositoryWeb** block.
trans-unit.target: To specify a report server, you use a **ReportRepositoryWeb** block.

trans-unit.source: A report server cannot be an SMB server.
trans-unit.target: A report server cannot be an SMB server.

trans-unit.source: The following metaconfiguration configures a pull client to get its configurations from **CONTOSO-PullSrv** and its resources from **CONTOSO-ResourceSrv**, and to send status reports to **CONTOSO-ReportSrv**:
trans-unit.target: The following metaconfiguration configures a pull client to get its configurations from **CONTOSO-PullSrv** and its resources from **CONTOSO-ResourceSrv**, and to send status reports to **CONTOSO-ReportSrv**:

trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.target: [Setting up a pull client with configuration ID](PullClientConfigNames.md)

trans-unit.target: [Setting up a DSC web pull server](pullServer.md)
